unnormalised: Someone asked me about cybersecurity in India, and honestly, it's a mixed bag. On one hand, you've got companies like TCS and Infosys offering top-notch services, and the govt is pushing for "Digital India". But on the other, awareness among regular folks is still pretty low. I mean, how many people still click on dodgy links they get on WhatsApp? A lot, I'm betting. Also, most small businesses don’t even think about cybersecurity until they get hacked. Saw one restaurant get hit with ransomware last year, lost all their data!

unnormalised: The thing is, cyber threats are evolving fast. We're talking about everything from phishing scams to sophisticated attacks targeting critical infrastructure. Like, a power grid in Mumbai got hit a while back, right? And the amount of data being stolen is insane. Personal info, financial details... it's all up for grabs. Even something simple like using "123456" as your password (which, sadly, many still do) makes you an easy target. You NEED a strong, unique password for EVERY account. Use a password manager if you have to!

unnormalised: So, what can you do? First, educate yourself. There are tons of free resources online. Second, update your software regularly. Those updates often include crucial security patches. Third, be careful what you click on! If it looks suspicious, it probably is. And finally, use strong passwords and enable two-factor authentication (2FA) wherever possible. Companies should invest in proper cybersecurity measures and train their employees. It's not a luxury anymore, it's a necessity! Consider getting help from experts, check out firms like K7 Computing or Quick Heal, rated 4.5/5 stars on some sites, to help beef up protection.
